What I think has impacted on me lately has been the rival home of the bodies from Afghanistan.
Because that's the sort of thing, when my father was in the army in the First World War,
all the way through, the worst part of it actually, wouldn't speak about it at all.
But Armistice Day meant something to him.
And then over the years that disappeared, people didn't concentrate, they would think about it, you know, it still drifted away.
And suddenly, the war in Afghanistan and Iraq has registered.
And I think seeing these bodies come back in coffins has had an impact.
